intro: Sauvagesia guianensis subsp. guaiquinimensis, commonly known as the Guaiquinimense Guianense, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Its leaves are usually large, palmately lobed, and have a rough, hairy texture. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
